resources.string: You cannot have Morgana without Percival, or Percival/Assassin/Morgana/Mordred without Merlin. In 5-player mode, you also cannot have Percival without either Morgana or Mordred.
Roles in Secret Hitler are fixed.
To mute, tap and hold on \"NONE\".
EVERYONE, close your eyes, and extend your hand into a fist in front of you.
AGENTS OF EVIL, wake up, and look for other agents of Evil.
AGENTS OF EVIL, except OBERON, wake up, and look for other agents of Evil.
AGENTS OF EVIL, close your eyes.
MERLIN, wake up. AGENTS OF EVIL, stick out your thumb, so that Merlin can see who you are.
MERLIN, wake up. AGENTS OF EVIL, except MORDRED, stick out your thumb, so that Merlin can see who you are.
AGENTS OF EVIL, put your thumbs away. MERLIN, close your eyes.
PERCIVAL, wake up. MERLIN, stick out your thumb, so that Percival can see who you are.
PERCIVAL, wake up. MERLIN and MORGANA, stick out your thumb, so that Percival can see who you are.
MERLIN, put your thumb away. PERCIVAL, close your eyes.
MERLIN and MORGANA, put your thumbs away. PERCIVAL, close your eyes.
FASCIST and HITLER, wake up, and look for each other.
FASCIST and HITLER, close your eyes.
EVERYONE, close your eyes, and extend your hand into a fist in front of you.
FASCISTS, except HITLER, wake up, and look for other Fascists.
HITLER, stick out your thumb, so that the Fascists can see who you are.
HITLER, put your thumb away. FASCISTS, close your eyes.

\"The Resistance: Avalon\" is a game for 5–10 players, designed by Don Eskridge, developed by Travis Worthington, and published by Indie Boards and Cards. It is a trademark of Don Eskridge and Indie Boards and Cards.\n

\"Secret Hitler\" is a game for 5–10 players, created by Mike Boxleiter, Tommy Maranges, and Max Temkin, and published by Goat, Wolf, & Cabbage LLC. It is copyrighted by Mike Boxleiter, Tommy Maranges, Max Temkin, and Goat, Wolf, & Cabbage LLC.\n

For the avoidance of doubt, this app is not affiliated with or sponsored by Don Eskridge, Travis Worthington, Indie Boards and Cards, Mike Boxleiter, Tommy Maranges, Max Temkin, or Goat, Wolf, & Cabbage LLC. No money was made through the distribution of this app.\n
You\'ll need the original \"The Resistance: Avalon\" and/or \"Secret Hitler\" games in order to use this app.\n
Choose the number of players along the top of the main screen. The range of characters who are available for selection will be automatically adapted to the number of players selected.\n

The special roles in \"The Resistance: Avalon\" are: Merlin, Assassin, Percival, Morgana, Mordred, and Oberon. Select the special roles that you’re using by tapping them on the main screen. Selected (active) characters will have a white frame around them.\n

Some selection rules will apply. For example, you cannot have Morgana without Percival, or Percival/Assassin/Morgana/Mordred without Merlin. In addition, in a 5-player game, you cannot have Percival without either Morgana or Mordred. Some characters will be automatically selected/deselected depending on the selection/deselection of other characters.\n
The only special role in \"Secret Hitler\" is Hitler himself. However, none of the roles in \"Secret Hitler\" can be selected/deselected directly.\n
Tap the Play button when you\'re ready for the night phase to begin (i.e. for all players to close their eyes and for the playback/narration of the introduction script).\n
Tap the gear icon in the lower right corner to view the settings screen, which allows you to customize every aspect of the app.\n

On the Settings screen, tapping the Back button returns you to the main screen. Tapping the Help button displays this Help that you\'re reading now. Tapping the app creator\'s personal logo takes you to his website.\n
The Narration Settings allows you to change the volume of the narration.\n
The Background Settings allows you to change the background sounds and their volume. These background sounds are played during the night phase (to help cover up any sounds made by players).\n
This timer determines the length of the pause during the action of the roles that wake up at night, namely: Merlin, Percival, the Agents of Evil (except Oberon), Hitler, and/or the Fascists).\n
Tap and hold the image of each character to learn his/her role in the game.\n

When the app is active on the narration screen, as well as at any time an audio track is being played, the app prevents your device from going to sleep. If playing for extended periods of time, you should plug in your device or change the brightness to a low setting.\n
Notifications (calls, mail, messages, etc.) may interrupt the playback of the app, depending on how your notifications are set up.\n

This app was developed by Li-Wei Yap. The code within this app is Copyright © 2021 Li-Wei Yap and licensed under the GNU General Public Licence v3.0. The code may not be reproduced without citation.\n

The character artwork for \"The Resistance: Avalon\" was designed entirely by Indie Boards and Cards and others including Luis Francisco, George Patsouras, Marco Turini, Pablo Messuti, and Luis Tomas. For the purposes of this app, the character artwork for \"The Resistance: Avalon\" was cartoonified using the Cartoon Photo Editor from Lyrebird Studio.\n
The character artwork for \"Secret Hitler\" was designed entirely by Mackenzie Schubert.\n
The app background was designed by \'Logos by Nick\'.\n
The ARKHAM fonts used in the app were designed by James Cianciaruso.\n
The gear icon in the settings button was taken from www.flaticon.com and designed by Freepik.\n
The voice of the narrator is \"en-US-Wavenet-B\" from the Text-to-Speech API of the Google Cloud SDK.\n

The cards background sound was taken from the YouTube Audio library. The rest of the background sounds were taken from SoundBible.com. The crickets background sound was recorded anonymously. The fireplace background sound was recorded by Daniel Simion. The rain background sound was recorded by Mark DiAngelo. The rainforest background sound was recorded by glorysunz. The rainstorm background sound was recorded by Mike Koenig. The wolves background sound was recorded by fws.gov.\n
The overall app design was inspired by the One Night Ultimate Werewolf app by Bezier Games, Inc., Ted Alspach, Andre Infante, Jeremiah Maher, Akihisa Okui, Gus Batts, and Eric Summerer.\n

The app developer would like to express his deepest gratitude to Rui Xiang Peh, Isla Lim, Darrell Wong, and Li-Toong Yap for their generous help in the internal testing of the app and in providing valuable feedback.\n
The app developer sincerely apologises in advance if he has forgotten to acknowledge/credit anybody else who needs to be acknowledged/credited.\n

The name is a portmanteau of \"narrator\" and \"Nadir\", which is the last name of Abed, one of the main characters of the American television sitcom \"Community\". In one episode involving delicious chicken fingers, Abed narrated a good chunk of the story line, as if \"in a mafia movie\" (his own words). In two other episodes featuring Dungeons & Dragons, Abed was the Dungeon Master, whose tasks include narration. The launcher icon of the app is also a reference to the school logo of Greendale Community College, which is the main setting of this sitcom.
Li-Wei Yap built the Narradir app (an Avalon/Secret Hitler Narrator app) as a Free app. This SERVICE is provided by Li-Wei Yap at no cost and is intended for use as is.\n
I do not collect, use, or share your Personal Information, period.\n
I physically can\'t. I have nowhere to store it. I don\'t even have a server database to store it. So even if Kim Jong-un asked nicely to see your data, I wouldn\'t have anything to show him.\n
Nonetheless, the app does use third party services that may collect information used to identify you.\n
Link to privacy policy of third party service providers used by the app

I want to inform you that whenever you use my Service, in a case of an error in the app I collect data and information (through third party products) on your phone called Log Data. This Log Data may include information such as your device name, operating system version, the configuration of the app when utilizing my Service, the time and date of your use of the Service, and other statistics.\n

This Service contains a link to my personal website. If you click on the link, you will be directed to that site. Whilst I do not collect, use, or share any of your Personal Information on my website either, the website is hosted on GitHub Pages. In addition, the website contains icons from JSDELIVR and Font Awesome, as well as fonts from Google Fonts. Please note that GitHub, JSDELIVR, Font Awesome, and Google Fonts may collect User Personal Information from visitors to my website, including logs of visitor IP addresses, to comply with legal obligations, and to maintain the security and integrity of the website.\n
Links to privacy policy of these other sites
Please refer to the respective Children\'s Privacy Policies of Google Play Services, GitHub Pages, and JSDELIVR.

I may update my Privacy Policy from time to time. Thus, you are advised to review this page periodically for any changes. I will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page.\n
This policy is effective as of 11 April 2021.\n
If you have any questions or suggestions about my Privacy Policy, do not hesitate to contact me at liweiyap [AT] gmail [DOT] com.
This privacy policy page was created at privacypolicytemplate.net and modified/generated by App Privacy Policy Generator, which was created by Nishant Srivastava and others.
Character to be displayed during the reading of the current segment of the introduction.
Personal logo of author of code.
Click on Merlin to select or deselect him. If Merlin is deselected, then Percival, Assassin, Morgana, and Mordred are auto-deselected.
Click on Percival to select or deselect him. If Percival is selected, then Merlin is auto-selected. If Percival is deselected, then Morgana is auto-deselected.

Clicking on the Loyal Servant of Arthur has no effect, as he/she can be neither selected or deselected. Instead, he/she will be auto-selected or auto-deselected depending on the selection or deselection of the special roles Merlin, Percival, Assassin, Morgana, Mordred, and Oberon.
Click on the Assassin to select or deselect her. If the Assassin is selected, then Merlin is auto-selected, and the opposite is also true.
Click on Morgana to select or deselect her. If Morgana is selected, then Merlin and Percival are auto-selected.
Click on Mordred to select or deselect him. If Mordred is selected, then Merlin is auto-selected.
Click on Oberon to select or deselect him.

Clicking on the Minion of Mordred has no effect, as he can be neither selected or deselected. Instead, he will be auto-selected or auto-deselected depending on the selection or deselection of the special roles Merlin, Percival, Assassin, Morgana, Mordred, and Oberon.
Clicking on the Liberal has no effect, as he can be neither selected or deselected. Use the player number selection buttons above instead.
Clicking on Hitler has no effect, as he can be neither selected or deselected. Use the player number selection buttons above instead.
Clicking on the Fascist has no effect, as he can be neither selected or deselected. Use the player number selection buttons above instead.
Click on the Settings Button to navigate to the Settings page.
